chargeHist.descr: Operating a Motor Vehicle While Intoxicated - 4th Offense in 5 Years

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating With Prohibited Alcohol Concentration - 4th Offense in 5 Years [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating With Prohibited Alcohol Concentration - 4th Offense in 5 Years [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Jonathan Joseph Nokken was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid at the rate of $100 per month commencing 10/1/15 and on the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full.    If not paid, one day in jail for each $40.00 of unpaid fines.

The defendant is to pay the Blood Draw Fee and the Ignition Interlock Surcharge.  To be paid at the rate of $100 per month commencing 10/1/15 and on the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full.    If not paid, one day in jail for each $40.00 of unpaid fines.

The defendant may serve jail sentence in the Jackson County Jail.  The defendant is to report to the Jackson County Jail in Black River Falls by 4:00 pm on 8/4/15.  After the 1st 48 hours, the defendant is eligible for huber privileges at the Jackson County Jail.
The defendant to receive credit for any time lost administratively.

Any vehicle(s) titled in the Defendant's name and/or any vehicle(s) operated by the Defendant are subject to an ignition interlock device.  The ignition interlock requirement becomes effective when the Defendant applies for a license.
The defendant is to receive an alcohol assessment and comply with any driver's safety plan.
